Description: Handle-plate sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of dolphin (back, dorsal fin, and part of tail missing) to left; incised splinter rosette as filling ornament; black around edges with band of added red; black with traces of red on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Carter, R. E. 'A Terracotta Tetrapod Dedication at Corinth', Hesperia 22, 1953, 211, pl. 65, no. 5 (dolphin facing right). According to Amyx (1988, 508) dolphins on Corinthian handle-plates are rare.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. XXIII, no. 26)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.019) (Phase 1)
